ygData.subject: Re: What is the best way to raise faction level with the Merchants of Felwithe?
ygData.msgSnippet: This faction loss came from just ONE slaying of a high elf?  That s a pretty steep penalty.  What is Verant thinking, attaching this penalty to dueling.  I
ygData.messageBody:
This faction loss came from just ONE slaying of a high elf? That's a pretty steep penalty. What is Verant thinking, attaching this penalty to dueling. I assume you were dueling, weren't you? Or are you all PVP+?
----- Original Message -----
From: Mike Browne
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
Sent: Wednesday, July 07, 1999 8:50 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] What is the best way to raise faction level with the Merchants of Felwithe?


Hello, fellow Wizards!

Several weeks ago I participated in a guild war and slew a High Elf not knowing that there would be a faction hit as a result. Well, I can no longer purchase or sell items in Felwithe. I've tried everything that I know of to improve my faction standing with the Merchants there, but to no avail. My faction standing with the guards is "amiable" -- It is with the "Merchants" that I need a faction adjustment. Does anyone have any ideas? Suggestions? Personal experience? Would appreciate any and all advice.

Wizzy Lightseeker
L25 Gnome Wizard
Solusek Ro
